org.apache.taverna.osgilauncher

Class OsgiLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.osgilauncher.OsgiLauncher

  • public class OsgiLauncher
extends Object
    OSGi Framework launcher. Handles loading and starting of OSGi bundles and Spring DM managed services. An implementation of an OSGi Service Platform Release 4.1 (or higher) must be available on the classpath.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_BOOT_DELEGATION_PACKAGES
      Default boot delegation packages.
      static String DEFAULT_SYSTEM_PACKAGES
      Default system packages.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OsgiLauncher

        public OsgiLauncher(File storageDirectory,
                    File bundleDirectory)
        Constructs an OsgiLauncher that loads bundles from a directory. Any file in the specified directory with a .jar extension will be loaded when the framework is started.
        Parameters:
        storageDirectory - persistent storage area used by the framework
        storageDirectory - the directory containing bundles to load

      • OsgiLauncher

        public OsgiLauncher(File storageDirectory,
                    List<URI> bundleURIs)
        Constructs an OsgiLauncher that loads the specified bundles.
        Parameters:
        storageDirectory - persistent storage area used by the framework
        bundleURIs - bundles to load

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException
        Starts the OSGi framework, installs and starts the bundles.
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the framework could not be started

      • startServices

        public void startServices(boolean waitForServices)
                   throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException
        Starts SpringDM managed services.
        Parameters:
        waitForServices - if true waits for services to start before returning
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the framework has not been started or a service could not be started

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException,
                 InterruptedException
        Stops the OSGI framework.
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the framework has not been started
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while the framework is stopping

      • installBundles

        public List<org.osgi.framework.Bundle> installBundles(List<URI> bundlesURIs)
                                               throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException
        Installs the bundles specified by the URIs into the framework.
        Parameters:
        bundlesURIs - the URIs of the bundles to install
        Returns:
        the installed bundles
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if a bundle could not be installed

        Installs the bundle specified by the URI into the framework.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the installed bundle
        Throws:

      • startBundles

        public void startBundles(List<org.osgi.framework.Bundle> bundles)
                  throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException
        Starts the bundles. If a bundle is a fragment bundle that bundle is not started.
        Parameters:
        bundles - the bundles to start
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if a bundle could not be started

      • startBundle

        public void startBundle(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
                 throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException
        Starts the bundle. If the bundle is a fragment bundle the bundle is not started.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to start
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the bundle could not be started

      • getContext

        public org.osgi.framework.BundleContext getContext()
        Returns the context. Returns null if the framework is not started.
        Returns:
        the context

      • addBootDelegationPackages

        public void addBootDelegationPackages(String additionalBootDelegationPackages)
        Adds boot delegation packages. Multiple packages must be separated by a ','.
        Parameters:
